messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Where I live
messages.msgSnippet: Nice to see other Canadians here!! I am in Ontario, Canada. Between Ottawa & Toronto. Except that I am VERY rural being surrounded by all farmland near a small
messages.messageBody:
Nice to see other Canadians here!!

I am in Ontario, Canada. Between Ottawa & Toronto. Except that I am VERY
rural being surrounded by all farmland near a small village. We live in a
forest (in a house of course :) )

My brother & his wife & 2 children live near Vancouver. They are
"mainstream" though.

Kerri, mom to Amanda(14), Emma(12), B(11, foster dd), Maddison(10), J(9,
foster dd), Jonah(7), Saige & Claire (4, ID twin dds) & baby boy Teagan (10
mos)

> Message: 3
> Date: Thu, 5 Aug 2004 23:24:07 -0700
> From: "susan spyker" <susata@...>
> Subject: where I live
>
>
>
>
> In reply to the below:
> Tia I live in the Black Creek area which is in the Comox Valley. I
> have two daughters one is just recently 10 and the other is to be 12 in
> a month. We have been on the island for just about two years now coming
> from central Alberta via a 2 year stint in Nelson, BC. Thanks for
> asking.
> Susan
> >
> >[] This conference by title sounds very interesting but I have never
> >heard of it. I am obviously in the dark up here on Vancouver Island,
> >BC, Canada. When is it? Where is it? What is the website as I presume
> >there is one?
> >Thanks
> >Susan
>
> Susan, where are you on the Island? I'm in Sooke. My unschooler is 16.
> Tia
